content: When a PR is merged to fix an issue, should I signal that the issue can be closed ?
If yes, who should I ping (especially on old issues where the author might not respond anymore) ?
You can add fixes #70107 or closes #70107 to your PR to automatically close the relevant issue.
Oh, today I learned, thanks a lot !
If the PR is already merged, I think the best way is to add a comment on the issue mentioning that it should now be fixed
and in case the author or a team member does not close it in the next few days you can ask on zulip or the PR itself I guess :thinking:
Will do ! I have to say contributing to Rust way less scary than I expected with all the people answering questions
That's the goal :sparkles:

lcnr said:

You can add fixes #70107 or closes #70107 to your PR to automatically close the relevant issue.

When is the issue closed in this case: when I open the PR, during the PR, after the PR is successfully merged ?

Also, do titles like Short Description. fixes #1234 work ?
Looks like it needs to be in the description

You can also use closing keywords in a commit message. The issue will be closed when you merge the commit into the default branch, but the pull request that contains the commit will not be listed as a linked pull request.

This is in the github doc. As I understand it, it means that PRs should have one of their commit contains Fix #1234 (or similar) ?

An example might be https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/72061. This PR contains closes #70180 in its description.

I prefer mentioning the relevant issue in the description of the PR instead of a commit.
